name: Diandra
biography: Diandra Danielle Flores is a Finnish singer who uses just her first name Diandra as her stage name. Diandra Flores's father is Chilean] and her mother is Finnish. Diandra was born in Finland, but moved to Chile when she was three years old and lived there for two years, where she also learned a little Spanish. He started playing the violin at the age of six. At the age of eight, he started singing duo performances with his sister. In autumn 2004, Flores won the children's singing competition Staraoke. Flores studied in high school, but dropped out in the fall of his third year. However, he continued his studies at the Lahti Conservatory, where he completed his bachelor's degree in musicianship. He graduated as a musician in May 2013. Flores is a synesthetic, meaning he sees music in colors and shapes.
vocalist_visual: A beautiful, slightly overweight, long-haired, feminine woman
